characters: SUDDENLY THE SOUND OF TIRES BURN... CATFISH'S VAN SEARS D
A MASSIVE GOEX BLAST IN TWO DIRECTIONS. HITS THE CAR'S RE
SLOWLY PULL AWAY AND TRACK OVER THE MASSACRE...
THE MUZZLE FLASH. GASOLINE IGNITES. BUZZ GOES UP IN FLAME
CAR IS BLOWN SIDEWAYS AND WRAPS AROUND A LIGHT POST.
WE HEAR THE SOUND OF HARD WATER FROM A SINK OFF-SCREEN
...THE DOOR SLIDES OPEN AS AB SOLDIERS OPEN FIRE FROM SUB
THE CAR'S FRONT DOOR DROPS OPEN AND TOM CRAWLS OUT. CHARR
A DEAFENING SILENCE SPREADS OVER THE CAFETERIA.
I/E. OUR LADY OF THE LAKE HOSPITAL
WINDSHIELDS OF PARKED CARS SHATTER. NEIGHBORHOOD HOMES. T
SUDDENLY HEADLIGHTS FLOOD MARANDINO'S REAR WINDSHIELD.
AN INTERSTATE SIGN PASSES ON THE RIGHT
INTO LUCIAN WITH THE IMPACT OF A TRUCK. BOTH HIT THE FLOO

dialogues.speaker: LANDSCAPES
dialogues.text: A rusted Chevy El Camino drives against dissolving Louisi landscapes - broad, barren, pounded by the rain.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. EL CAMINO, TRAVELING
dialogues.text: Occasional oncoming headlights illuminate the driver's fa Tense, course features, thick beard... He's BUD CARTER, 3

dialogues.speaker: AN INTERSTATE SIGN PASSES ON THE RIGHT
dialogues.text: Bud pulls onto a dirt road, into a TRAILER PARK and stops

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TITLE IN: Denham Springs, Louisiana. 1983. We're staring at three sacks of sample unmounted EMERALDS set on a filthy counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now these here are Brazilian, from Bahia. Deep cuts. Damn good. These is India, paler, but also good. And this is Columbia. From them limestone caves up in Muzo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDEN to reveal NADY GRACE, 35. A tattooed man with thinn hair, leading Bud through the sale...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now them first two, you gonna get your money's worth. (re: COLUMBIA EMERALDS) This one here's more expensive, but that's 'cause there ain't a nigger flaw in one of 'em. They hard as steel and emerald green as emerald green fuckin' comes. Lookit that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the real McCoy. That's what that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what... Bag 'em all. The market's got a hard-on for this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear that. (across the room) Jake, get on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACROSS THE ROOM are two other men -- JAKE and DOUG. Ex-co at a table, riffing through Bud's cash. A CURTAIN YANKS BACK and RAY WHEELER, 29, enters. Dope-th bloodshot eyes. He looks at Bud. Bud looks at him... Ray clicks on the TV and opens a beer.  TV IN: Evening news. The storm outside alters the recepti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And today, thirty-one year old Gary Plauche pleaded innocent by reason of insanity, to charges of second-degree murder in the slaying of accused sex offender, Jeffrey Doucett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud watches Ray empty a gram of coke onto the bar. Using credit card, Ray starts chopping lines. The SOUND continu throughout the scene...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...District Court Judge Frank Salia, scheduled the trial one year to the day after Doucett was first arrested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace hefts a lock box to the counter, removes a drawer o emeralds. Bud SEES packed carelessly underneath, uncut DIAMONDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you got there? Diamonds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's thirty grand. Out the door. You interested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't got the scratch right now. But I am interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the volume of the TV now becomes more apparent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...As a result of numerous threats made weeks ago, tight security surrounded the courthouse. However, missing from today's hearing, was the arresting officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud has been tuning out the TV distraction... until that statement. He sneaks a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From East Baton Rouge Sheriff's office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wave of static scrambles the picture. When it clears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Police Lieutenant, Bud Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud is stunned. HIS OWN FACE APPEARS ON THE SCREEN. A you photo of Bud, clean shaven - DRESSED IN POLICE UNIFORM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain pours. A beat-up PLUMBER'S VAN is parked in the dist

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV IN: Signal wavers. It's archive footage of Baton Rouge Airport. A prisoner, JEFFREY DOUCETT, escorted by police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doucett was being extradited to Baton Rouge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray does a line of coke, keeps chopping. Watches the TV. Grace is bagging emeralds. Jake and Doug count cash. Bud keeps the TV in sight. Quick glances. Mind racing. TV IN: The procession moves past a row of pay phones. At phone, a discreet figure, GARY PLAUCHE, turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The victim's father, Gary Plauche, stood waiting at the terminal. As Doucett walked by, Plauche turned, raised a handgun...and fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud's vision is suddenly obscured when Grace steps forwar with the emeralds in a satchel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go. Fifteen three-karat blues. Wholesale. Twenty large.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sudden GUNSHOTS and SCREAMS on the TV. Everyone turns... TV IN: Jeffrey Doucett lies dead as POLICE wrestle Gary Plauche to the ground amid chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Carter was unavailable for comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON RAY'S EYES, intense, watching the footage.  As Bud stuffs the satchel in his coat, WE SEE what Ray sees... TV IN: Bud, POLICE BADGE AROUND HIS NECK, arresting Plauc ON RAY, slow burn realization as he looks from the tv to And again. EYES LOCK, THEY BOTH KNOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker, he's a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud yanks a .45. And everything happens at once. A SUDDEN GUNSHOT and Jake FIRES again. Wood splinters as Bud FIRES back. Jake is HIT in the throat. A SECOND SHOT in the forehead SLAMS against the window, cracking it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among surveillance equipment, sits Bud's crew: TODD SHEPA DAVID MARANDINO and DALE COBB. Gunshots ECHO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! Go! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marandino, behind the wheel, SLAMS his foot on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOT ZIPS across Bud's back; he SPINS off the table. On his knees, Doug is firing a .32. BLAM BLAM BLAM BLAM. Bud FIRES a burst through Doug's chest, dropping him. A HOLE EXPLODES beside Bud's head -- Grace FIRING a .45 - Ray SCREAMS and runs out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marandino winds through gears, as Ray hits the yard running...  POV THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD: Marandino swings the wheel ha SLAMS INTO RAY -- launching him through trash bins, into mud. Cobb jumps from the van and pounds Ray into handcuffs. Simultaneously, Shepard sprints for the trailer door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace explodes from the back door, bolting across the yar

dialogues.speaker: I/E. GRACE'S TRAILER
dialogues.text: Bud scrambles on the floor of the demolished trailer. .45 held tight, he runs out after Grace.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE YARD
dialogues.text: the chase rages.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: as he jumps a link fence, lands and trips into a roll of chicken wire. His sleeve catches, rips as he pulls free..

dialogues.speaker: BUD
dialogues.text: at a searing pace. He slips in the mud. Staggers up. SEES Grace disappear in the shadows. Grace throws himself against the side of a power unit. Ey darting. Wheezing hard... Tries to slow his breath. Then turns the corner... GRACE'S POV: A SHOVEL swings from around the corner, WHAM The blow sends Grace sailing back. He SLAMS on the ground with a blood-covered broken face. As he tries to get up.. Bud's gun is there. And like that, it stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a table, the METRO SQUAD: Bud, Shepard, Marandino, Cob are drinking. A bartender (SHERRY) is wiping down glasses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think I broke a knuckle on that guy's tooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He only had one tooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I got it, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the bartender) Another round, Sherry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comin' up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud blows smoke, distant from the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, we all supposed to be celebratin'. 'Been workin' this case for months. And you ain't said shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had a lot of weight. Too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a ring. Organized burglary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw them guys. You think that half ass crew was organized?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) They shit their pants in unison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gettin' after, Bud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it was someone else's score.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherry arrives with shots of whiskey, moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think its a part of somethin' bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud takes his shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow morning we put our friends under the lamp. If they know this "someone else", we'll know him too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark, stone monolith off the 110 highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud smokes, standing with Shepard in semi-darkness. They' looking through a two-way mirror into an INTERROGATION RO where Cobb interviews Ray Wheeler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you... I keep tellin' you... I don't know nothin'. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not it. We've been here all morning. We'll stay here all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud paces to a neighboring INTERROGATION ROOM where Maran is questioning Grace (bruised face, swollen, broken nose)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stones you were fencin' belonged to an Amsec wall safe in "Kay's Jewelers". The rest from a vault in Bocage. Both owners can verify their belongings, and have.  (beat) Who you fencin' for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I ain't sayin' fuckin' shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then your name's on a dozen other jobs, just like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's a promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, sipping coffee, paces back to Ray's interview...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a series of burglaries in the area. All over the last six months. All still open. You don't talk, it's on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I ain't got nothin' to do with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any idea who does?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Okay? Fuck no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud sets down his coffee, calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marandino sits across from Grace, clearly frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) MAN FUCK THIS! AND FUCK YOU! Y'ALL CREW'S JUST FAGGOTS IN MATCHING JACKETS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door blasts open. Bud charges in, throws Grace agains the wall, then slams his face onto the table, pushing dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try this. I know you're too fuckin' dumb to be any more than a courier. I know you're coverin' for someone else. NOW TELL ME WHO THAT SOMEONE IS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't a rat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU AIN'T A RAT?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud twists his broken nose. Grace SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Bud. Go easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Marandino) STOP THIS SHIT! STOP HIM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marandino puts a hand on Bud's shoulder; Bud shoves him o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOCK THE DOOR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marandino locks it. Bud turns Grace's nose even harder, nearly rips it off his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll teach you what commitment is... I'll throw you in an eight by nine and have you fucked in the ass by every inmate in the state of Louisiana-- AND THAT'S THE REST OF YOUR LIFE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, spitting blood now. Choking. Bud twists. Bone crac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIVE ME A NAME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hacking) He's from Whiskey Bay--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --GIVE ME A NAME!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raining. An unmarked chevy is staked down the block from a tract h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse Wheeler. Thirty-one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud's in the front seat, looking through a file. Shepard the wheel. Coffee cups and junk food litter the dash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two tours in 'Nam. '69 and '71. He's a jump marine. Weapons trained, explosives. (turns the page) Seven and a half out of a twelve year stint for federal robbery. Two in Angola. A year in DeQuincy. Three in El Reno with a transfer to Lewisburg. Then Marion with a brief stopover in Leavenworth. Released from Oxford, 1981.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacket's the size of the bible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the windshield, across the street, a tract home they're watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His stay at Marion, they kept him in "H" block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H block? That's home to forty top murder one inmates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, life sentences. Jesse only had twelve years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud likes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't just woodwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night passes and the dawn arrives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Front door opens and the shadowy figure of JESSE WHEELER, whose face we cannot see, emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waking Bud) Target's out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse fires up his '74 battered green PICK-UP TRUCK. He b from the driveway and proceeds down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Alright. Give him room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud's car starts and we move off with them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) We're mobile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the rain, Bud and Shepard tail Jesse from a distance. They pass an alley where a waiting BUICK falls in behind Chevy; Marandino and Cobb are inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the truck slowing, angling into a TEXACO STATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's turnin' off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take him in the car. (into radio) Wait'll he's stopped. Watch your backgrounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse stops at a pump. Suddenly, Bud appears at the windo and jams a SHOTGUN against Jesse's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move. You motherfuck, I'll blow your head clean off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reflecting in the side-view: Bud's BADGE swings from his neck. Jesse's eyes resign to relief. Bud SEES this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the car off slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With several law enforcement shotguns now leveled at him all directions, Jesse turns off his engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, Shepard, Cobb and Marandino, vests and shotguns, mov unison around the house. Bud and Cobb stay to the shadows, down a side yard... Shepard, Marandino reach the front door. Locked. A tv pla quietly inside. No one in the windows.  Shepard signals to Marandino...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FRONT DOOR IS KICKED DOWN. Shepard and Marandino spil in, guns ready...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE! WARRANT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pregnant woman in the kitchen... LYNN WHEELER, 30s. She SCREAMS, curses. Hurling dirty dishes fly like frisbees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET OUT! GET THE FUCK OUT OF MY HOUSE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MA'AM, CALM DOWN! CALM DOWN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE GOT A WARRANT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more dishes) FUCK YOU! FUCK YOU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn suddenly gasps agitatedly, sinks to the floor. A GUS FLUID soaks through her dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help... My baby...my baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud and Cobb enter from a back door, hurry towards Lynn. lowers Lynn to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cobb) CALL AN AMBULANCE! NOW!

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: A door slams open to reveal... A NAZI IRON EAGLE BATTLE FLAG. Draped across the far wall Windows taped over. Walls painted black. Military surplus on every shelf and surface. Helmets. Uniforms. Body armor. Bayonets. Bud in the doorway. Shepard joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toss everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several COPS(now on scene) ransack the house. Ripping ope cabinets, drawers, tossing everything to the floor...

dialogues.speaker: GARAGE
dialogues.text: Cobb flips a switch. A lamp illuminates a workbench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I want everything seized!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cabinets, lockers and tool boxes slam open. Cops stop col blown away by what they see: GUNS. Everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: COP #1 feels behind a couch. He finds a .38, then a COLT below a chair cushion.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: COP #2 removes the toilet's basin cover. With a pen, he removes a dripping .357.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Several STATE TROOPERS lead Jesse in, cuff him to a table

dialogues.speaker: ATTIC
dialogues.text: Floor peels back. Flashlights illuminate: AMMUNITION BOXE ASSAULT RIFLES. GRENADES. BONDS and COUNTERFEIT PLATES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker's got a general store.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Cops talk excitedly over one another. Shepard leans over mounted A.C. He finds a string and very slowly pulls up a ziploc bag filled with DIAMONDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn...there's some weight.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Bud takes a seat at the table... For the first time, we get a good look at Jesse Wheeler: eyes. Handlebar mustache. Covered in tats. With a boilermaker's build, he looks what he is... DANGEROUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Detective Lieutenant Bud Carter, of the East Baton Rouge Parish Precinct. (smiles) So how you like Baton Rouge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's stare drifts to Bud. It's deadly. Cabinets slam open and closed. Dishes hit the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to my wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water broke. She's en route to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COP #3 is searching the refrigerator. Jesse watches as if he's seen something we haven't... Cop #3 moves on... Jesse sees Bud's eyes. They connect with his own... Bud opens the fridge. He scans condiments then stops. Fro inside a bag of HOT DOG BUNS, several sealed VIALS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud examines a vial's label: "CYANIDE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the cyanide for, Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extracting impurities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, right with him, grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impurities from what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse, calm. Deadpan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in a bad situation here, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud looks in Jesse's eyes and believes it.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Shepard, searching the room. Drawers, cabinets. Then lean down to peer under the bed...  ...stops, stunned when he SEES: a row of live Goex charge packing, boldly marked: EXPLOSIVES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (top of his lungs) OUT! EVERYONE OUT! GET THE FUCK OUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE BRADDOCK (40s), Captain of Detectives, enters his office. Bud tows, carrying files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What more do you want? You got a two time felon on multiple counts. You got robbery, B&E, you got an all-you-can-eat felony fuckin' possession. All on top of an organized burglary ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A CAMERA FLASH. Mug shots of Jesse's front and profile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man's in custody, Bud. Fucked for life. It's finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's inked fingers are rolled onto an exemplar sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more, I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud slaps a file on Braddock's desk, to a crime scene pho An Asian JUDGE sits dead in the front seat of his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember him? Ten months ago, a judge gets popped with a .357. Well I got a Ruger from Wheeler's toilet and rushed it through ballistics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a solid match! Dead on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a dozen ways Wheeler could've got that burner. It don't prove a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drops another file) A stack of bonds taken from the home of a Baptist Minister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crime photo: A black MINISTER and wife shot in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murdered. He and his wife. Looked like a robbery gone to shit then; I want it opened back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nude Jesse steps before a DOCTOR and gets a cursory exa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still got tests pending. More guns. More cases. This guy ain't crazy, Mike. He's a ticket to somethin' big. Somethin' happening now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who's backin' him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know; I do know they'll post his bond. That's why I need a price they can't come up with overnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braddock listens. Bud keeps it on track...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right about this, Mike. (leans close) When a guy's lookin' at two hundred years and he ain't upset... It's like when your wife is accusing you of fuckin' the neighbor, but she don't know you're fuckin' her sister too. You're pretty calm about it, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braddock smiles slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 'cause we hit the wrong nerve. The guns, the other shit, the time... He can have that conversation. And he is. And he ain't upset. He's makin' eye contact, 'cause we're fallin' short. (the bottom line) This guy knows things. He knows where bodies are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braddock, thinks; Then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bounce it up to the D.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud grins, SLAMS his hand on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two GUARDS escort Jesse. He's bound in chains, orange scr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End of the hall. A BLACK PRISONER waits, arms slung over crossbars with a cigarette. Jesse is brought forth. A Guard unlocks the cell. The Black Prisoner steps back, joining TWO OTHERS: All black, looming in the darkness. Jesse steps in. Guards unlock his shackles. Chains hit th floor. Behind him, the bars slam home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Jesse Wheeler... I'm now in charge of this cell. Any y'all don't like it, step your black ass forward, line up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MOMENT. Cued by Jesse's challenge, each of the prisoner slowly rise, vehemently approaching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the phone RINGS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answers) Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud? Charlie Bowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDEN. Bud's house is sparsely furnished. Books on firear and police work in stacks. As he reaches for a file...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Charlie... You had an inmate in '75, named Jesse Wheeler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE BOWERS, on an official phone. At Jesse's name, he DEAD QUIET...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your interest in this guy, Bud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we got him on weapons and burglary. But I got a feelin' there's more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn straight, a lot more. Race riots. Smuggling. Extorting a guard. I had a few run-ins with him myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud lies in bed, wide awake. The PHONE CONVERSATION carri over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could say this is where he peaked.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Coffee pours into a mug. Then a shot of Irish Whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a white supremacist. The worst kind, if there is one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, dressed now. The table is covered with various repor and photos from Jesse's file. BUD'S EYES guide us through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Came in on armed robbery and assault...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud picks up a photo: Jesse's Angola mug shot, age 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But word in the system said, he's a contract killer for the Aryan Brotherhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photos of Jesse's tattoos: SUN-WHEEL on the shoulder; HEL HOUNDS around the biceps, THOR'S ELAPID covering his back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here, the guy became an organizer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud's face goes in and out of light and shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Controlling hits and movements inside the system. Prison to prison. State to state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud is walking with MURPHY, captain of the guards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between the Aryan Brotherhood and Neo Nazis, he unified the front...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud and Murphy descend steps to a grim CORRIDOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All them prison gangs in the world... Black Panthers, Mexican Mafia, forget it. The AB is deadly as it gets. And Jesse Wheeler was their ring leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE CONVERSATION fades out... Presently:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what the fuck happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Processing ain't open till morning. We threw him in holding last night. 'Fore we even turn around, it's like we're back in the fuckin' Alamo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He attack the guards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guards are fine. But he took on three niggers like they stole from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy stops outside a solid steel door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you somethin', Bud. After it happened, our block was the quietest it'd ever been. Wish we had ten just like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud enters. Murphy shuts the door and a series of locks B We're in a stone closet. No bed or sink. No light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard you refused a public defender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's bruised face moves through shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the gas station...When you were arrested, I put a gun to your head.    You expected someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look like cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your house? Guns. Mass supply tells me, intent to sell. Cyanide in the fridge, explosives...tells me you're scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's eyes emerge from the dark. Bud, looking right at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you knew that much, you wouldn't be in here alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud smiles and walks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more thing, pal. I saw the judge this morning. (grins) There is no bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD on Jesse. Bud BANGS on the door. Locks UNLATCH. The door opens and steps calmly out to the hall... The door shuts with a BOOM, locking Jesse in. And the nai the coffin resonates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dim and desolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace buys a ticket, crosses the lobby to the men's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace at the sink. He pats running water on his damaged f and straightens the bandage.

dialogues.speaker: A TOILET FLUSHES
dialogues.text: the stall door opens and a man emerges. Lean and fierce, an electric charge... CATFISH STANTON, 30. Grace FREEZES at the sight of Catfish, tightening his bel Lets the water run...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace? That you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, Catfish...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish steps close, reaches a hand to Grace's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The hell happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace flinches. Catfish pauses, then SNIFFS his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Oh... Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish steps to the sink. Begins washing his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where you off to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goin' to visit my mother. She's real sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too bad. So you'll be gone a long time then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another MAN suddenly enters. Large and imposing, neck tat ...BUZZ MCKINNON, 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swallows hard) Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish turns off the water. THE BATHROOM IS SUFFOCATED W SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do y'all for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come the Wheeler brothers, is locked up? And you ain't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheeler brothers is locked up? I don't know nothin' about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish GRINS. It's harsh. Blood curdling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well there ain't no "different" to hear, Catfish. 'Cause I ain't talked to neither of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you did talk to someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz moves. Grace turns to look... ...In a blink, Catfish's gun comes up: ONE QUICK POP. A . with a thick, barrel silencer. The mirror shatters. Grace knees hit the floor. His head hits the sink, HOLDS. As bl runs from one small hole. Catfish straightens up in the next mirror. Tucks his shir Grace's body sags to the floor. Catfish and Buzz walk out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUD BUZZER. Two GUARDS #1 and #2 march Jesse down the ti On his left, PRISONERS in cells, TURN, STARE and WHISPER. Jesse arrives at a cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out) Open ninety-six!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARS slide back. Jesse walks in. His CELL-MATE steps cautiously from the shadows...  IT'S RAY. Pale and nervous. Jesse stands over him. The brothers' eyes connect. And there's a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High stone walls topped with concertina wire. Looming gua towers. Thick FOG blankets the yard filled with CONVICTS. Jesse takes hold of a metal bar, lifts it from a bench pr He does two reps. The weights BANG down and Jesse sits up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is bad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray adds weight to the already excessive amount. He sweat he talks nervously over Jesse's shoulder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's eyes everywhere. Like I got a sign on my back, Jesse, they all think I talked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse scans numerous WHITE CONS watching the Wheeler brot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the other day... some spic fish got hit with a weight. Ten other cons, they beat him and stabbed him till there weren't nothin' left. And the guards let it happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray fastens the safety collars and Jesse leans back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His brains were on the wall, Jesse. Like somebody painted 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse does another set. Weights BANG down. He slowly sits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come at you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet... But it's in the mail. I can feel it fuckin' coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray shoots a look at a group of ARYAN BROTHERS across the yard. CZAPP, their "leader," and ROACH. Jesse turns. Czap looks at him. Eyes meet. Jesse leans back. The press shakes as Jesse does a last set. His red strain face as the bar lands with a CRASH.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: A long line of prisoners are filing back through the gate Ray, behind Jesse. Says low:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jesse...  (silence) Sorry I put you back here. I never meant--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns) "Sorry", Raymond...? You ain't sorry. (pause) I took you into my home. I tried to clean you up. And you steal from me...? You take my fuckin' diamonds?  (dead to rights) 'Cause of you, I missed the birth of my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray swallows hard. Nothing he can say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON numerous files of ARYAN GANG MEMBERS. Arrest she paperwork and photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let's work this... (beat) In prison, Wheeler is credited for the expansion of the Brotherhood. When Federal split up members, they had to reorganize. So they tattooed their blood types and serial numbers on one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recede and multiply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL NOW Bud and Shepard with Cobb and Marandino around table, used as a converted eating area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put 'em in prison, they get stronger. Everywhere you send one, they recruit in numbers. Within five years, their numbers were over ten thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheeler directed all that, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard is flipping through a worn, thick file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you got there, Shep'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interpol wired us files on three known Aryan leaders in the state of Louisiana: Edgar Bingham. Harold Kay. And this man... Lucian Adams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the file, revealing mugshots of LUCIAN ADAMS, 51 Dark eyes. Sharp, gun metal features.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High priest of the Aryan National Party. His "ministry" of Christian Identity and Paramilitary Order has stood for over a decade. Check this out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard pulls an old, faded surveillance photo: (Long sho Lucian talking to a young Jesse outside a compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheeler was just seventeen when he met Lucian at the Patriotic Congress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today, Lucian's one hell of an entrepreneur. Owns surplus stores. Demolition. A piping business. Got trucks runnin' all across the God damn country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud's been quiet; says now:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay focused. Get back to Wheeler... I need an angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? If Wheeler ever flipped, news would spread like wildfire. The AB's gonna know about it. They'd gonna know about it nationally. (re: his coffee) Pass the sugar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marandino does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's if he was a surface informant. I don't want him to testify. I want to keep him on the street. (to the group) Look, this guy's been in it a long time. He's up to his elbows; wants to shake his hands free. I can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braddock ain't gonna go for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll handle that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks to Bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got one chance here. 'Cause if this falls short... Jesse Wheeler's worth more dead than alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sea of tables divided by race as far as the eye can see Jesse and Ray, trays in hand, find an island of ARYAN PRISONERS. They quickly part to make room for Jesse to si Suddenly Czapp and Roach arrive with their trays and abru sit across from the Wheeler brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin', Ray? (off Ray's look) We was just over there wonderin' why you ain't got the courtesy to introduce us to your kin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) I'm sure you was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Czapp locks on Jesse, who calmly eats, not looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse Wheeler. Heard of you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin-A, heard a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name's Czapp... You can call me, "Bossman." (beat) I kept an eye on your brother the past few days for you. Ain't that right, Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low) Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother ain't none of your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't none of my business, "Bossman." And everything in this fuckin' place is my business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray nervously glances down at several Aryans watching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jesse) Listen to me, you sonofabitch. I'm gonna make one God damn thing God damn clear. Your reputation is smoke. Whatever they say you is or once was, I don't give a flyin' fuck. 'Cause it's my say-so now. And your fuckin' brother's up for grabs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Czapp looks away from Jesse and shouts down the table:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all got that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Jesse SPRINGS. A headbutt EXPLODES Czapp's nose throws him back. Czapp's head hits linoleum, echoing with a CRACK!! He lie still. Bloodied and unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stumbles away, shocked) Fuck...

dialogues.speaker: A DEAFENING SILENCE SPREADS OVER THE CAFETERIA.
dialogues.text: Jesse calmly resumes eating. Czapp's blood covers his fac SUDDENLY AN ALARM BLARES. GUARDS pour in, led by Murphy. INMATES HIT THE DECK, arms behind their heads. All except Jesse, who continues to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHEELER!!! Stand the fuck up! Hands behind your head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands behind your head! Get on the fuckin' floor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse puts his hands behind his head, but does not kneel. Restraints are slammed on Jesse's wrists. And we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door unlocks and drags open. Jesse turns, blinking painfully into the light ...Sees an imposing DUTY GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is led in. Duty Guard hits an extension button on a desk phone and offers the receiver... Jesse doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a secure line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duty Guard walks out. Alone now, Jesse picks up the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A low, whiskey voice is HEARD over the line: LUCIAN ADAMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been a long time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse shuts his eyes. There's a moment before he opens th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read about the arrest, Jesse. There's a lot of heat on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want my brother touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs faintly) I ain't callin' about your brother. I'm callin' about you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse turns SLOW to find the Duty Guard watching him from hall. Lights a cigarette, stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have come to me sooner, Jesse. None of this would have happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm askin' you, Lucian. My brother ain't a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother's a fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Jesse's quiet... Dead quiet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Jesse... We may know what you can do. But you know what we can do. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse hesitates, then Lucian hangs up. DIAL TONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Room strewn with piles of casework. Bud, agitated, paces. Braddock, behind a desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're reachin', Bud. The leverage ain't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's there. It's gotta cook a little longer, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse won't so much as blink at doin' life. The fuckin' guy didn't rise in the ranks 'cause he skirts under pressure. (beat) There's no deal to be had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Mike, you know what's goin' on. Ray Wheeler compromised Jesse. By that, he compromised the Brotherhood. Don't tell me there ain't no fuckin' leverage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud pours himself a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need somethin' more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we ain't sleepin' till we find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn, dark pouches under her eyes, goes through security check. INFANT SON in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: VISITING AREA
dialogues.text: Wives, girlfriends and lawyers talk to prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: TABLE
dialogues.text: Lynn, dark pouches under her eyes, holding their son, acr from Jesse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life. You know how fuckin' long that is, Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's hands are shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what am I supposed to do? Wait? Run? (upset) Your friends are comin' by the house. Askin' questions, hangin' around. Waitin' for the God damn phone to ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said we were done with this. That they were out of our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby begins to CRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no money, Jesse. Which means we have no fucking food. ...Say something, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid. I'm afraid for my life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby WAILING now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly crying) ...For our baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON JESSE, for the first time, appearing powerless. As Lynn wipes tears, trembling in her seat, Jesse looks a from his son, and glances up... Behind a glass partition outlying the room, a MAN is watc them... BUD. Stark still. Fixing Jesse with a hard stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLERK passes Lynn her belongings through chain link. Sh wipes her eyes, holding the baby. The back bay doors open. Bud enters. Sleepless, wrinkled clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn Wheeler. We haven't been properly introduced. I'm Detective Bud Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a ride home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We took the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud peels a few bills from a fold, puts it on the counter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud lays his card atop the bills, looks at Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'You need anything...anything at all. Be sure to call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other. She pulls her baby close. There' unspoken moment. And Bud walks away...  Lynn waits till Bud is out of view. Then takes the money. the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Guard buzzes Jesse through. PRISONERS line the tier. Smoking cigarettes. Looking out. Jesse walks past, enters...

dialogues.speaker: HIS CELL
dialogues.text: ...where Ray sleeps in shadow on the bottom bunk. Jesse pulls a Polaroid from his pocket: His infant son. H gazes at the photo for a beat, then brings it to Ray...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. Jesse nudges his brother's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raymond, take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse rolls him over. Ray is limp. A filthy SYRINGE imbed his arm. Jaw slack. Eyes wide and vacant. THE PHOTO FLUTTERS FROM JESSE'S HAND TO THE FLOOR... Jesse lowers, pulling Ray to his arms. He shuts his eyes. Teeth clench. And as Jesse feels the bile rising, his mas frame begins to shake... Then we realize, he's crying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pouring rain. Ray's corpse is loaded onto an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse sits in shadow. Alone. And it's still...

dialogues.speaker: AFTER HOURS
dialogues.text: Jesse sleeps. Hand under the pillow. When there's a sound His eyes SNAP OPEN to discover the silhouettes of SIX MEN rushing into his cell... A LOADED SOCK swings out from Jesse's pillow, slams MAN # the jaw with a CRACK!! On his feet, Jesse whips the sock around and whacks MAN # head against the concrete wall. He slumps down unconsciou A BLUNT OBJECT is rammed into Jesse's sternum. Another sh bangs his neck. The sock drops and a PADLOCK clatters out With a final burst of energy, Jesse turns, SCREAMS and ru MAN #3. Man #3 slams into the cell bars. CLANG!! Lights o The remaining three Men attack. A series of blows rain do and Jesse sinks into their grip. HALL LIGHTS BUMP ON: NOW WE SEE, THESE "MEN" ARE GUARDS. More GUARDS pour in, led by Murphy. They yank Jesse from cell and take him down the tier. Guards toss the cell in a thorough search. Mattress overturns. Shelves crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRISONERS move to their bars, SHOUTING and JEERING as Jes is wrestled down the STAIRS to...

dialogues.speaker: THE LOWER TIER
dialogues.text: Jesse thrashes violently as the Guards slam him through a door into...

dialogues.speaker: A TUNNEL
dialogues.text: between cell blocks. The ROAR of prisoners recedes as Jes dragged into darkness getting darker. A DOOR SLAMS OPEN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...THERE'S A FLASH OF LIGHT. We're in a windowless room. And Bud pouring coffee for two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want a cup of coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is handcuffed to the table. Guards are breathing ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOTHERFUCKER! This how you do things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... When I want to talk to someone, without giving the impression he's cooperatin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse pauses, caught by Bud's tactics. The Guards file ou and shut the door. Jesse's eyes are fierce and watching Bud's every movement he hands him a coffee, then takes a seat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To start with, you're lookin' at two hundred years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done the time. I'll do it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you can do it. But can your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's face is tense. Unyielding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother's dead, Jesse. As we're sittin' here now, he's on a slab at St. Gabriel's Morgue. The coroner's callin' it, "suicide". You and I both know that's a load of shit. (beat) You do the time-- sure. And you never see your kid. 'Cept in here. You can recruit him. Your wife...plans...everything... Gone. (beat) 'Less you talk...to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse silent, a dark internal pause. He meets Bud's eyes across the table; then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's sudden directness has caught Bud off-guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you hate the most? Blacks you throw in prison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I dislike what they represent in the system. Not as a whole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Jesse begins to consciously or unconsciously "preach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you believe that by overthrowin' Aryan nationalism and integratin' races...polluted creeds, with us...You believe you're solvin' somethin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe we survive by integrating safety. Understanding hate, and how to stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't evil to fight it. It's evil to tolerate it. (leans in) Maybe you forget that, to justify what you do for a living...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we still in prison, or we back at the compound, havin' mass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't dictate to me what put you in here, or question my intentions with your overcooked revolution! (beat) 'Fact, I think you wanted out 'fore I even got to you! That's why you distanced yourself. That's why you're out there crackin' safes. Lookin' to live a life that ain't AB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In who I am, there's pressure! I work for you, I won't need a lawyer, I'll need a priest! My outside finance is gone... My wife and son, their heads wind up somewhere their bodies ain't! So tell me, why the fuck should I get involved with you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about personal warranty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warranty?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right! You've been a part of the problem so long, you've forgotten what the fuck that is! (boaring in) "Finance..." Your wife came here on a bus to see you. I sent her home in a cab. Is that your outside fuckin' finance?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Jesse, taken back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me give you a little insight, pal. As to what I know... And what you think you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud flips open a file and shoves a series of grainy B&amp SURVEILLANCE PHOTOS in front of Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is today...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photo #1: Outside Jesse's House. A distressed Lynn and th baby being led into a car by Catfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your house? That's your wife, right? Who's this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photo #2: Tight-shot of Catfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Jesse's look) Know where he's takin' them? Takin' your family? I got a pretty good fuckin' idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photo #3: An anonymous duplex. Catfish escorting Lynn and baby inside, past several surly Aryans looking on. Jesse finally averts his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at your wife, Jesse. Look at her face. And your son. They look safe to you?   (a moment) I'm all you've got! I'm all your family's got! And the longer you're in here, they're up for grabs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JESSE. The wheels turning. Burning. THE CAMERA MOVES I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So either you let that happen... Or I get the judge to allow bond. This never sees trial. And you work for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's where it hangs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse Wheeler. Please rise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse rises, wearing a suit. JUDGE PONDER, at the bench, presides over this arraignment hearing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stand accused of forty counts of burglary, twenty nine counts of felony theft, possession of illegal firearms, possession or dealing in unregistered weapons, possession of a controlled substance, manufacture and possession of incendiary devices, and seventeen counts of receiving stolen goods... How do you plead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO DANIEL KIERSEY, 40s, sharp, confident, expensively dressed. Jesse's attorney, rising:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not guilty, Your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hear the arguments for bail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DISTRICT ATTORNEY rises from his seat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor, this man is an habitual felon as well as a flight risk. Our office has overwhelming evidence that Mr. Wheeler is not only guilty, but also a serious threat to the community. The State recommends that bail be denied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor, my client deserves a reasonable bail. He has every intention of appearing and answering to all these false charges. In addition, he is the sole provider for his wife and newborn child, who would suffer undo hardship if this man were incarcerated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO Judge Ponder:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond is set at one million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GAVEL BANGS DOWN. Kiersey shakes Jesse's hand. Smiles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL BUD -- seated in back, watching the proceedings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn, asleep in bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse stands, holding his son, quietly comforting him. Wh Jesse turns, WE SEE a .45 tucked in his back. AND THE PHONE RINGS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answers) Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STATIC; he listens, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse steps through his fence into deep WOODS, to find a waiting idyll on a dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HEAVY-SET MAN at the wheel. Jesse gets in as the headli spin on and the car pulls away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Eerie and desolate. The car arrives. Jesse steps ou and disappears into the shadows of a towering crane. On the jetty, a nondescript MAN stands alone against the Mississippi. His back is to us.  Jesse approaches, stands quietly beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We realize now...It's Bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get somethin' straight. I ain't here 'cause I'm scared. I done what I did, 'cause certain people crossed the line. They didn't keep their word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well my word counts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand together, facing the liquid horizon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a body, Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud finally looks at Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A swamp area used as a mud retrieval source for the levy. Amite River. FOG OBSCURES NEARLY EVERYTHING. Jesse slowly emerges... Then Bud and Metro, on all sides, LIGHTS, FLAK JACKETS and SHOTGUNS. A DUFFEL BAG of SHOVEL The sounds of the swamp are terrifying. Herons and bobcat Boots hitting water. The buzz of a million mosquitos. SUDDENLY A RUSHING SOUND -- An ALLIGATOR shoves off the m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb's light catches the tail whipping into the swamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yard dog. Relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's this motherfucker taking us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse suddenly STOPS. LISTENS. BREATHES. Bud and Metro st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (directly to Bud) Dig here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metro exchanges looks, ANXIOUS. Bud nods "okay".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metro engulfed in fog. Picks and shovels rise and fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud! We hit something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud excitedly descends the pit to scrape gravel from meta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear it off! Come on, find the edges!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse watches as a pair of STEEL DRUMS emerge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "cold room". Bud and Braddock watch as two PATHOLOGIS hose down the drums. The stench is horrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long they been down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse tells me six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six months? Bud, they're biodegraded by now. Fuckin' worm food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get an ID. Remember, we got the guy who put 'em there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLOW TORCHES ROAR as Pathologists burn through the drums. Sparks fly. The lids CRASH. Swamp water floods out... And immersed within: two sore-covered, DECOMPOSING BODIES. The room recoils from the fumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn is putting dishes away. The baby nearby, sleeps quie in a swing. Lynn gazes out the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is under the hood of his truck, fixing the engine.. When a '71 Mustang, white-on-white, roars up the street.  Jesse glances over as the car pulls alongside the drivewa It's CATFISH, at the wheel. A wolfish grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bout time to get a new truck there, Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse tightens a nut with a torque wrench, says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you out. A free man now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on, 'Fish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a Sunday drive, that's all. The good Lord ridin' shotgun, through another glorious Louisiana mornin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse EYES his .45 atop the engine block, within reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Jesse... Lucian's askin' about you. Fact, a lot of people are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse stays on the engine, never turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell him I'll come by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no longer smiling) That's good. I'll see you real soon then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Catfish drives away... We HEAR a series of photos bein taken at high-speed. FREEZE FRAME to BLACK & WHITE. PULL BACK to a distant CONSTRUCTION TRAILER. Bud with a l lens camera, triggers snapshots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greasy spoon, soul food joint. Trucker and labor patrons. Bud walks in, perplexed to find Braddock sitting with    MARTIN FITCH (30), Deputy Chief of Staff for US Attorney General. Pressed suit. Young face. Out of his element.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, this is Special Agent, Martin Fitch. He's down from Washington. With the Attorney General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin. Just call me Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitch offers his hand, smiles. Bud shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin's gonna be soliciting Jesse's case for a Federal sponsor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you been with the Attorney General, Fitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just over a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud looks at Braddock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to assure you my education and experience is more than adequate to handle a case of this potential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitch's smile drops as Bud stares him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we get to the particulars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Alright. (clears throat) To get Jesse a federal sponsor, we need something substantial. A bait. In the Justice Department, we have this mission statement... We decide who the target is, what's the threat assessment, the cost value, over what time table it's gonna take place... Which target do we go after first. We don't want to miss a big target hitting a smaller target, you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, exposing bodies has limitations. Those people are dead. We can't retrieve their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He means there might not be enough to back Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep him on the street without protection, he winds up dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm saying is, we need fresh leads. He'll need to present something that separates him from those we're going to arrest. If Jesse can't offer something continuous... I'm afraid we can't be of much help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud stares at Fitch.  A WAITRESS in her 50s approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuts in) Yes. I'll take a garden salad. Roquefort on the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll take what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (curt) It's a dressing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...we got ranch, thousand island and oil. Which one you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud's chair SCRAPES back as he stands, stares hard at Fit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost my appetite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud stalks out to his car. Braddock follows, agitated. Th say nothing till they reach the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I set this up. Me and Jesse. If the Feds want to help, that's fine. But not him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, "me and Jesse?" He's not your partner, Bud. This case is beyond our capacity. It requires resources we don't have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud unlocks the car. They stand, talking across the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ain't takin' us serious, Mike. They send us some kid with a year under his belt?! He don't even know what state he's in... You want him in charge?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're God damn right I do! You're out on a limb on this already, Bud! It's my job to make sure you get back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That may be. What it ain't, is open for discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braddock walks away. Bud simmers a moment, gets in his ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bare room; nothing to tell us where we are. Jesse's on stool. He runs his fingers down his mustache, grits his t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all wanna talk about crime? Well I could tell y'all things. Names. Locations. What boat is movin' what drugs, which one is guns. Who's gonna get cut up and why. ...But what I got to know is, if 'n when I do this... If I wear your dog collar... Y'all gonna do what's right by me and keep my head from gettin' shot the fuck off? 'Cause the truth is, you need me. You ain't got enough cops with enough sense or enough time, to clear them crimes that already been committed and will be. (pause) Y'all need me... I got the devil's address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE: We're in a HOTEL SUITE. Shades down. Full of AGENTS: FBI, ATF, DEA, SECRET SERVIC Law enforcement everywhere. On the furniture, against the wall, sitting on the floor. Staring at Jesse in silence. Bud stands by the door with Braddock. And Fitch steps forward, laughs nervously...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, great... Thanks. Thank you, Jesse, for that. And thank you, everyone for attending... (tight) Uh, we all know why we're here. To solve a matter of custody--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll protect you and your family, Jesse. (to the room) It's a federal matter, gentlemen. Those bodies were transported over state lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ATF AGENT #1 imposes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so fast. Ammunition, grenades? This man's house was a factory, for Christ's sake. ATF is taking this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those murders were drug related. DEA's got to do follow ups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was printing counterfeit money.  That's Secret Service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARGUING ENSUES, Agents' voices step over one another. Fit tries to take control. Jesse's been silent, until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a hit list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitch hears this. He turns, loudly to the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Wait a minute, quiet! Everyone quiet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And EVERYTHING stops. Fitch moves to Jesse:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hit list. There's much as twelve. Might be one or two less now, I ain't sure. Some could've already been gotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Braddock) Now we're talkin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI #2 approaches Jesse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why these twelve, Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different reasons. It ain't so much why or what they done that matters. Pick any one of 'em off that list, AB puts you on salary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is suddenly interested. Bud sees this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, sir, if I ain't mistaken... You're Mr. Nokes, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agents part, revealing JOHN NOKES(50s), black, an emminen figurehead in a plush suit. Surprised to be pointed out..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First U.S. Attorney, John Nokes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, last time I seen it...you was number two on that list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet. Nokes thinks. Then LAUGHS and approaches Jess

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you fill us in on the rest of those names, Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I can. But there's something I gotta make clear 'fore that happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've listened to you, Mr. Nokes. And I've listened to these suits here, on who's gonna take me in... (beat) I will die, go to hell and take all y'all cocksuckers with me, if he-- (motions to Bud) --tells me to. (beat) I want y'all to know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is explosive under the low projection delivery and CHILL falls over the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bud) How's that fly by you, Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud simply nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll sponsor him. Jesse's welfare will come out of our budget. Anyone has pending cases or leads for Jesse, see me. I'll loan him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse stares at Nokes. As the meeting settles back to a comfortable level...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, Jesse... I'm a little pissed I'm number two on that list. Who the fuck is number one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room erupts with LAUGHTER. Everyone except Bud and Je

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's truck moves over an old wooden bridge through sweeping fields that stretch to a vast, wooded area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse stops at a long drive protected by locked iron gate A surveillance camera zooms in. Jesse looks up. A second camera pans on Jesse, staring... MOVE IN as crackling, electronic pixels FILL THE FRAME an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BANK OF MONITORS showing Jesse at the gates. A GUARD si in shadow, hits a button: We see the gates unlock and ope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pulls down the private road. Shafts of light mottle then burst, REVEALING an elegant

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIAN HOME.
dialogues.text: Jesse parks -- walks up the porch, where Catfish is relax shoulder holster, revolver. And Buzz, cleaning a pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse nods, eyes Catfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to see Lucian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish grinds out his cigarette, gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's busy right now; You can come in and wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Louis XIII pours to the rim. From elsewhere in the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This operation of your's has become big business. You need relationships now more than ever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE VOICE belongs to RICHARD MORRIS, 40s. He sits in a leather chair, facing Lucian Adams, who's face we cannot Seated next to Morris, is Daniel Kiersey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We've done business successfully before, Mr. Adams. But it's a larger scope now. I'm here today because I want to represent you exclusively. You need someone lobbying at a state level, as well as in Washington. My organization can provide both. We've got contacts that you don't have and other people can't get. Now, I'm aware that you have multiple businesses... However you need one go-to guy, so that all your ventures stay coordinated and all transactions and contracts are realized. I am that person, Mr. Adams. That's what I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCIAN'S HAND lifts the cognac out of frame, drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this going to cost us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a retainer, I want an advance of three hundred-fifty thousand, along with ten percent of whatever economic benefit I bring to this organization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three-fifty? C'mon, Dick. That's out of line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want a quality global economic plan, that's what you pay for--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll give you two, Mr. Morris...That's what it's worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morris goes suddenly silent, looks across at Lucian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The advance is a drop in the bucket. The real money is the percentage. It's in your interest to see it my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morris stares across the desk, several tense moments. The

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morris emerges from the office. He glances at Jesse, then shrugs on his coat and leaves...  Jesse looks back at the office doorway. FOLLOW Jesse in..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...past Kiersey, behind a massive desk in this impeccable room, we finally SEE LUCIAN ADAMS. Jesse is not invited to sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kiersey) Give us a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiersey walks out and shuts the door...

dialogues.speaker: ON LUCIAN
dialogues.text: he crosses slowly to a credenza, selects a clean shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a son now, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he removes the shirt he's wearing, REVEAL tattoos: BLA SUN on his back. GERMAN RUNES, SS BOLTS, HRUNGNIR'S HEART And around his stomach, a belt of NORSE GODS with the wor "INVISIBLE EMPIRE." Prison tats, dark and aged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you name him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I named him Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucian, no emotion, puts on a pressed dress shirt, fasten cuff-links.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder) Heard the cops smacked you around inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Wasn't too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucian checks his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been a busy man, Jesse. More ways than one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you done just fine without me. Business rollin' through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Lucian finally turns; looks at Jesse, eyes measuring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last I saw you, you asked for time. Time to raise a family. Time to straighten things out.  (pause) I gave you that time... Then safe jobs start poppin' up. Lafayette. New Orleans. Clinton. Baton Rouge. All over. The boys, they think it's niggers, gone widespread on a hunt for pig's feet. But they all professional. Burn jobs. Hot-weld oxygen. Laid out, burned, laid back, perfect. (locked on Jesse) I knew right then and there, only a white respectable burglar could've done this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse smiles slightly. They know each other well... ...When Lucian's smile suddenly drops. There's a flash of controlled anger across his face; and WE FEEL a curtain o tension fall heavily on the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse... With all the work you been doin': Diamonds. Emeralds. A dozen safe jobs, behind my back... (predatory) Where's the tribute to the greater cause?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse he pulls from his pocket, a tiny pouch. Sets it on desk... He pours the contents into Lucian's palm: DIAMONDS and EMERALDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, I just needed time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucian approaches the desk, opens the pouch: DIAMONDS and EMERALDS... A slow smile spreads across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, even prophets stumble once in a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucian embraces Jesse. Tight. Then, softly in his ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a shame about your brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they part, their eyes meet. Something passes between them...
