dialogues.speaker: I/E. JESSE'S TRUCK, TRAVELING
dialogues.text: Jesse at the wheel, glances nervously in the rearview. Ly in the passenger seat, baby in her lap. They're driving u the cover of darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. Why do we have to leave the state? You're not tellin' me something. You're not tellin' me a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't safe here no more. You wanted out? This is out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marandino looks through BINOCULARS: As an electric fence slides back. Jesse's truck approaches, drives through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A twin-engine PLANE idylls. Lines of blue lights, strobe rivers, air traffic above... And Bud, leaning against a nearby car with Shepard and Cobb. Jesse helps Lynn and the baby from his truck. Together, t walk toward the plane... Bud, watching from a distance, nods to Lynn.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE PLANE
dialogues.text: Jesse and Lynn stare at each other. She's crying as he pu her close, one arm around the baby. He says something to we cannot hear... Then with the baby, Lynn boards her plane. An AGENT shuts door. The engine SCREAMS to life, taking off... Jesse turns to shield his face. Lights STROBE and BLAST.. Then, ABRUPT DARKNESS AND SILENCE...

dialogues.speaker: ON JESSE
dialogues.text: now alone on the tarmac. Bud approaches; then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucian took the stones. Talked about jobs. High-end, boxcar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your family's safe now. (beat) Let's go to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several AB SOLDIERS stand watch as Jesse pushes a heavy, drill through a jeweler's vault door... Jesse throws tumb and relock mechanisms aside, reaches in... jewels, gems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud and Jesse parked next to each other, trading info.

dialogues.speaker: E/I. VARIOUS HIDEOUTS
dialogues.text: AB counterfeiting bills... Printing press and metal plate Hands stain bills with coffee grounds and cigarettes, the industrial dryers... Jesse at a table behind tall stacks cash, inspecting, approving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud with Jesse. Info, names and written amounts. INSERTS: HANDS file serial numbers off guns... HANDS buil silencers... loading guns in suitcases below false bottom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse on the line... Bud on the other end, taking notes..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AB Soldiers unload crates from trucks, "Chrysler Corp.".. "Remington Firearms"... Antique furniture... Machinery... INSERT: A MONEY MACHINE counts large denominations of cas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked under the interstate. Bud looks over Jesse's info.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large fishing boat arrives. Numerous Fisherman load mar onto refrigerated trucks... Catfish, Buzz, numerous AB st up the trucks... Jesse hands the Head Fisherman a canvas of cash...  PULL BACK to reveal Shepard, Cobb and Marandino on the ro of a neighboring port, snapping photos. Taking notes.

dialogues.speaker: E/I. ISOLATED BARN
dialogues.text: Trucks arrive. AB bring the marlin inside... Atop a crate Jesse slices a marlin open, revealing kilos of cocaine. M marlins are cut. More cocaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud on the typewriter, hammering out Jesse's contacts and movements. Files piling on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An organizational chart, as Bud pins AB mug shots, arrest sheets and surveillance photos wall to wall. Bud steps back, observes. His case building. Getting huge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wood secluded. Lucian, Jesse and Kiersey sit around a tab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a variety of matters to discuss today, gentlemen. Eddie Moran's trial starts next week. One of the jurors reached out. He's asking six thousand up front plus a job at four hundred a week. That guarantees a hung jury with a push for an acquittal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hundred. Give him a no-show at the trucking firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he writes) Construction on the building Morris brought us, in south-east Florida, is complete. Every unit sold. We should see revenues of one point four million over our original projections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucian lights a cigar, smoke curls from his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lastly, our "friends" from the Middle East. They put a final offer on the table. They'll fund our operation in Louisiana if we agree to act on their behalf. Political targets mostly, on the basis of our approval... (beat) I advise we do a test case. Perhaps a sample of their resources.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Final offer?" Demands...  (beat) Close the deal. We'll cook the cash for it. By the time they realize, we'll have our return. (laughs to Jesse) You believe they're travelin' all the way to Louisiana just to get fuckin' robbed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Lucian walk together through green, expansive countryside. A pair of Arabian mares graze nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you runnin' point on this one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be honest, I was hopin' for somethin' bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you got in mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout a few of them heads off the list?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got guys for that now. Catfish, Buzz. What do you want to go back to that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money's worth twice this. Bring back a head it's fifteen grand; Bring a heart, it's thirty, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucian looks at Jesse, who feels Lucian's scrutiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what. Do this other thing we got lined up... (beat) Then I'll give you that taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, factory skyline. Burnt out cars sit before a WAREHO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEADQUARTERS for the Baton Rouge operation. A beehive of government activity. TECHNICIANS listen to tapes... PHONE ring off the hook... Bud and Fitch going over the case:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's pressure from Washington. They send compliments for Jesse's work. But our primary concern is that list. I need names we can protect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know that, Fitch. He's workin' on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Jesse can just get a direct order... from Lucian to him, on a wire--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --A wire?! He just went back to work, you want him to wear a fuckin' wire? (beat) Put a tap on that God damn lawyer's phone, that's what you should do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an attorney, Carter. Anything we get would be inadmissable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's information, Fitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitch, annoyed, but staying on track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud. We need Jesse to engage Lucian on the record. Otherwise it's just hearsay. He's disconnected from everything, like a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, cooling his heels. As the phones RING and RING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A violent rainfall. AERIAL SHOT swooping along the HIGHWAY, then rising above deep woods to reveal a TRUCK STOP ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closed for construction. A VAN arrives. A blinking barric is pulled back, allowing entrance... Generators light the scene: A group of SHIITE MUSLIMS wai a pair of idle FREIGHT TRUCKS. A crew of five AB SOLDIERS exit the van: Jesse, Catfish and Buzz among them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to one Freight truck rolls to the top, revealing converted ASSAULT WEAPONRY SHOWCASE. Below covered scaffolding, both crews stand. Guns bulge through their coats. No talking. No sudden movement.  Shiites watch Jesse and Catfish examine the merchandise: AUTOMATICS, SHOTGUNS, CARBINES, SUB-MACHINE GUNS... Everyone looks at each other. Jesse acknowledges worth. Catfish pulls a large CANVAS BAG from the van, filled wit cash. As he carries it toward a bench, a large Shiite (OM reaches for the bag before Catfish can set it down...  ...Both men hold tight. Neither letting go. And there's a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low) Catfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish and Omar are eye-to-eye. Then, Catfish lets go wi smile:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go 'head. Count it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shiite leader, NASEEM, sees the strife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. Money's all there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omar hands the bag to Naseem. The count starts. Both crew watch closely...   ...All except Catfish, fixated on Omar, who stares back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The fuck you lookin' at...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The count stops. Naseem looks to Omar. Questions in Arabi back and forth. The pressure getting to the group...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low) Catfish, would you shut the fuck up? This ain't the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Catfish) Yes, listen to your boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! What fuckin' "boss?" You best watch your ass, sand nigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piece of shit--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone reaches for their guns. Threats SHOUTED in Arabi and English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy! Take it easy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY ARC LIGHTS BEHIND A DISTANT BARRIER IGNITE, floo the scene. Everyone turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over a loud speaker) ATF! THE PERIMETER'S SURROUNDED!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omar reaches for the bag of cash... BLAM! Catfish FIRES, point blank, shooting Omar in the fa And World War III erupts. AB's FIRE. Shiites RETURN FIRE. From several stakeout locations, ATF AGENTS deploy and OPEN FIRE. Jesse is grazed in the shoulder, slips, staggers-runs. SHIITE #1 FIRES THREE SHOT BURSTS at AB #1, who's blown apart. A generator and ATF #1 collapse. ATF #2 and #3 with pump shotguns OPEN UP on the AB's van. Naseem, over a Mercedes roof, FIRES A BURST at ATF, then swings onto AB #2 and FIRES, killing him. Naseem jumps in the Mercedes, yells at the DRIVER to go. Buzz RAPID FIRES, hits Shiite #1 in the back. Shiite #1 i spun around and Buzz shoots him in the head. Catfish FIRES into the lot... Hitting SHIITE #2. IN THE MERCEDES, Driver floors it. ATF re-emerges, kneels PUMPS SHOTS into the Mercedes. Jesse has taken off, past the lumber storage. Catfish and Buzz follow, breaking for the Freight truck. IN THE MERCEDES, Driver is blown apart by ATF. The car CRASHES into a dumpster, knocking Naseem out. Jesse, Catfish and Buzz jump into the Freight. ATF FIRES. WINDOWS EXPLODE. SHIITE #3, trying to climb in is shot do Jesse, behind the wheel... BURNS rubber pulling out of th stop, over and through a scaffold, collapsing it. The Freight truck draws everyone's FIRE. Jesse pilots it through the CHAOS. Scaffold DRAGGING behind. Sparks fly. JESSE'S POV: Where he's going. An opening in the construction, leads back to the HIGHWAY and ONCOMING TRAF ATF CARS speeds in, the opposite way...

dialogues.speaker: AS THE VEHICLES PASS
dialogues.text: lock eyes. And the Freight makes the highway, scattering traffic, to the sound of ongoing GUNFIRE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon hangs low as Jesse parks the Freight truck among tall grass, where a vacant BREAD TRUCK is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Catfish exits the truck... ...Jesse takes Catfish's gun, grabs him by the neck and S him against the cab. FACE TO FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a piece of work, Catfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz grabs at Jesse; Jesse HURLS him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Them niggers crossed the line...I had to burn 'em--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --You had to keep your mouth shut! On a job, you don't do fuckin' shit 'less I say!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The fuck off me--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse slams him back again. HOLDS his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, deadly) Fuck me up again, you hear me? I'll leave you where I find you. Got that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUSE. Catfish glares, then concedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unload the fuckin' truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse starts moving crates from the Freight onto the brea truck. Catfish and Buzz watch for a moment, then join.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Televisions broadcast news coverage of the shoot-out. AGE work, uncomfortable, as Bud and Fitch argue. Explosive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your voice down! This was out of my control!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, your agents best pull their shit together! Who the hell y'all trying to protect?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Carter. This is a joint task force with multiple agendas, that run up the chain of command through me. Intel came forth at the eleventh hour that Naseem Kazuri - an international arms dealer - would be present at this meet. ATF was tasked to observe and report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't what they did--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --No! Because your informant--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My informant, that's right!--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Your informant and his psychopath crew greased half our political interests -- over a bag of fake cash! You weren't informed, so what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I better be informed! 'Cause this ain't fallin' short! Now, any of y'all got a collaborative agenda in the works? I want to see it. These other agencies, what time-lines they lookin' at? What deadlines and why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above your pay-grade--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) And is there a purposeful lack of communication between competing agencies, who are right now charting future mistakes, as we fuckin' speak?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not your concern, Carter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braddock suddenly arrives, steps into the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not talkin' about me!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spins) What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're over-involved here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Bud's taken off stride. Braddock looks Bud right in t eyes, so there's no doubt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, red with anger, walks out.  Braddock watches him go. Fitch comes over, relieved...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming down, Mike. He's been berating my agents for the last hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braddock pours a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're trying to band-aid a situation here, and frankly, Carter's preference for thug tactics isn't helping. It'll all be in my report...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts) "Isn't helping?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big mistake. Now Braddock turns on Fitch, zeroing in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Isn't helping?" Let's not miss what happened here, Fitch. We work for the same cause doesn't mean we work for you. What are you gonna do now? Send Jesse back out? Earn his trust? Bud Carter delivered the biggest informant in the history of this state to your lap, and you and the people you work for are gonna let it go to shit. (beat) You can expect that will be in my report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEELWORKERS warped in heat waves swing ingots into troug The seven story furnace is deafening.

dialogues.speaker: ENTRY AREA
dialogues.text: Lucian is met by Kiersey. They walk together through glas in hallways to a closed office door.  Lucian keys in, REVEALING a disheveled Morris seated in a chair with two large AB Soldiers on either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucian shuts the door and sits before an ill at ease Morr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. I had no previous knowledge of any business with Muslims. So if stealing me here in the middle of the night, is some kind of accusation--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not accusing you, Mr. Morris. But I do find it interesting that right about the time I employ you, my operation starts having problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is interesting...isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morris swallows hard as Lucian stares intensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know if this was an isolated incident. If the ATF impeding on my work is the result of a deeper threat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you suggesting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm suggesting you contact your friends in Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all due respect, Mr. Adams, that's not what I was retained for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sort of information requires clearance I don't have. If I start sniffing around, people are going to ask questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm asking questions, Mr. Morris. And I'm getting impatient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morris gets stone quiet. Lucian hands him a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't leave here till I get answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And like that, this conversation is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off a deserted street. A DENSE FOG resides, far as the ey can see. And Jesse, in a PHONE BOOTH, drops a dime and dials...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearly asleep) Hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? (off Jesse's silence) Honey, you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. Just need to hear your voice. How's little Ray...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll put him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE for a moment...then a quiet baby's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's daddy on the phone, say hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emotion rises to Jesse's face. He holds it in, barely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a lone CAR is parked in the shadows, fog rolling past...  ...Jesse sees it, can't see who's inside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.  A LONG MOMENT... Jesse stands there, watching the car... slowly makes his way toward the back of the store, where truck is parked. Pulse pounding, he tries the door...it's locked. Eyeing the car, he unlocks his truck.    THERE'S SUDDEN MOVEMENT. Jesse spins. And out of the dark -- steps Bud -- ready to pounce...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell you been? (Jesse's look) Two days missin', you broke protocol. Three, and you're a flight risk. Agents'll hunt your ass down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anger spiking, pacing) I can't keep doin' this. I can't fuckin' breathe. Even the shadows got eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the job. If I don't hear from you, I can't protect you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in his face) Protect me?! I about got my head fuckin' shot off, 'cause your guys was "protecting" me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those ain't my guys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a fuck-- I don't want your protection! I want out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no "out." Not for either of us. Not till it's done... (low, definitive) Get me that list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse STARES -- a malevolence in his eyes that freezes Bu the spot. Then, Jesse climbs in his truck and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Bud pacing; Braddock sits at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm losin' him, Mike...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just relax. We gotta let things settle, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't gonna settle, it's gonna blow. I can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push 'em back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Feds. All these suits, fuckin' outsiders. Everyone. Get me some room. Some time to reel this thing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to Nokes. 'See what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morris (a nervous wreck, unshaven) sits across from Lucia Kiersey at an adjacent table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an investigation underway, funded by the U.S. Attorney. And you're the target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morris opens his briefcase and hands over a pair of dossi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're receiving assistance from both the ATF and FBI, who are stationed right here in Henderson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) How long they been active?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sources tell me three months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucian puts on his reading glasses, opens a dossier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three months...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucian peruses surveillance photos: Images of AB activity goes by in a blur. Lucian's eyes absorbing, rigid, unerri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) This is U.S. Attorney John Nokes, at the helm. He's been after us for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who they got for a mouthpiece?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "mouthpiece"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the rat in the woodpile? Who the fuck's giving 'em information?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't dig that deep. But it's someone close. (pause) I suggest you gentlemen disband. Immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiersey, foraging through reports. Page after page. Each minutely detailed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucian...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The investigation's local point is a detective out of East Baton Rouge. (beat) His name's Bud Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON LUCIAN. Thinking...Thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse, alone in the dark, seated on the couch... There's SOUND outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse moves soundlessly through the house, gun ready, tow the back door. JESSE'S POV: as the door opens slow, HE/WE SEE ON THE POR

dialogues.speaker: LUCIAN
dialogues.text: seated comfortably in a chair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse looks to the darkness. Dogwood trees. Thick growth. EERIE SILENCE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got somethin' on your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking at him) There's been an adjustment to the list, Jesse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's silent. YOU CAN CUT THE TENSION WITH A KNIFE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got this...heathen. A whore of an Irishman...down in Baton Rouge. He's protected. Got a lot of guys around him. That's why it pays. That's why nobody wants the job... That's why we're here talkin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucian sets a photo on the table, face down with an addre written on back.  Jesse flips over the photo: It's Bud, in uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This cop... he's got a mouthpiece... somewhere. Ain't yet figured out who. In the meantime, shut him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JESSE, a frozen moment. He forces out the words:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Lucian gets up and leaves, disappearing into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse climbs into his truck and pulls out to the street..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSE'S TRUCK heading up the INTERSTATE, crossing into EA BATON ROUGE, then driving through dark RESIDENTIAL STREET Bud's neighborhood...

dialogues.speaker: I/E. JESSE'S TRUCK
dialogues.text: He pulls to the curb, parks. Jesse racks a MOSSBERG SG, l it with solid shot, then lays the gun on his lap.  THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD: Bud's house in the distance. And Jesse sits there, several moments...WAITS...BREATHES. Then he exits the truck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse moves -- fast, soundless -- toward the house. With shotgun, scales the fence, as we--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VAN arrives, stops. No headlights, two hundred yards fr the house. INSIDE THE VAN: Catfish and Buzz. Several AB SOLDIERS in back, armed to the teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's his truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Let's see what he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motor ticks and ticks and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark, quiet; but the muted glow of a tv in the livin room. JESSE MOVES IN SHADOW, shotgun leading... He stops.

dialogues.speaker: WE HEAR THE SOUND OF HARD WATER FROM A SINK OFF-SCREEN
dialogues.text: ...Jesse moves toward it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish, Buzz, the soldiers watching Bud's house intently

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck's takin' so long?  (beat) I would've shot that pig dead already... 'made a pulled-pork sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him a minute. That's a cop, lives there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks his watch) I'll give him two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish, loading his gun, as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a window, WE SEE Bud washing dishes. Then, slippi INTO FRAME...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: watching him. Pulse pounding, his mind on overdrive, tryi to untangle identity and consequence... Then... He taps the window, and Bud looks up...

dialogues.speaker: THE BACK DOOR
dialogues.text: Bud opens it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse. 'The hell you doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been made, Bud. We gotta skin out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish, anxious now, racking his gun again and again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somethin's wrong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Catfish. You said two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, man! This don't feel right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give it a second.  (to soldiers in back) A few more seconds, right guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish, breathing hard, bent on bloodshed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's kill 'em both. Let's do it now, right now, let's go--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (erupts) LET'S GO!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud quickly dials the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone, answers) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hey. Meet me at the office in ten minutes. Cobb and Marandino too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone) Why, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I'll explain later. Just get there. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS as Bud hangs up, shoves a .38 in his waistband Slams a clip and holsters a 9MM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jesse) Let's hit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud and Jesse start for the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AB Soldiers loading their guns.

dialogues.speaker: CATFISH
dialogues.text: starts the engine; POV THRU THE WINDSHIELD: Jesse and Bud leaving the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's them! Together, you see?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see 'em--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see?! They're fuckin' dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse hurries down the lawn. Bud to his Chevy.

dialogues.speaker: MACHINE GUNS.
dialogues.text: Jesse drops behind a neighbor's sedan. Bud dives behind the Chevy. ROUNDS SLAM through sheet met interior, and out the other end.  AB Soldiers exit the van, spread and keep FIRING. Jesse's sedan takes hits. WINDOWS AND TIRES EXPLODE.  Bud and Jesse aim over their roofs. Take and RETURN FIRE. Catfish emerges, kneels and pumps SHOTS into Bud's Chevy. The WINDSHIELD is BLOWN APART -- Shattered glass covers B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard at the wheel. We hear dispatch on the police scan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filter) All units: 10-17 in progress. 1825 Hyacinth. Multiple shots fired--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Units please respond...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard hits the BRAKES, peels a hard U-turn and SLAMS th gas toward Bud's house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz rounds the van and OPENS FIRE. Jesse and Bud cover. Their eyes connect. Bud signals towa the house. Jesse nods... ...then lays cover fire with the Mossberg. AB #3 is spun thrown.  Bud, under fire and firing back, races back into the hous Jesse keeps FIRING.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BUD'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Bud YANKS an M-16 from the closet and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Jesse, on his knees, pulls a secondary .45 from his waist and fires over the hood of the sedan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crumbles hard) Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse hits the dirt, WRIST PUMPING BLOOD. AB #4 and #5 move in for the kill, when out of nowhere -- SHEPARD'S CAR SPEEDS ON SCENE -- His door kicks out; SHEP PUMPS SHOTS, EXCHANGING. Buzz comes up from behind, aims -- BULLETS FLASH AND PUNC THROUGH SHEPARD.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: Bud swings the M-16 through the glass and BLASTS AWAY, killing AB #4, as Jesse staggers toward the house, holdin his wrist... ...and DIVES inside, then kicks the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish, Buzz and AB Soldiers flank the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the floor, Jesse rips out his belt, a tourniquet aroun the armpit. He holds it with his teeth and ties his arm. Bud reloads and slides Jesse a .357 Python. Jesse takes i with his good hand. Suddenly in the darkness beyond, MUZZLE FLASHES DISCHARGE THREE TRIPLE-AUGHT ROUNDS EXPLODE. Bud ducks, scrambles, rounds splinter the wall.  A BACK KITCHEN DOOR is bashed open and AB #5 steps in, BLAZING SHOTS. Bud lets fly -- FIRING. Big bore rounds punch through AB His insides hit the wall.  WE NOW HEAR DISTANT POLICE SIRENS APPROACHING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LONG-HAIRED AB on the lawn fires dozens of shots from a M-1. Catfish and Bud exchange CROSSFIRE as... ...Buzz starts up the van and Catfish jumps in, followed Long-Hair...

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BUD'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Bud runs out to the street, M-16 FIRING at the fleeing va Bullets shatter the back window as the van speeds around corner through garbage cans and a residential fence...

dialogues.speaker: ON BUD
dialogues.text: standing there. He turns, and STOPS when he SEES...

dialogues.speaker: SHEPARD
dialogues.text: inert, bullet-ridden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepard! (runs over) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud holds his partner, horrified. Around them, bodies on lawn. Disabled vehicles. Doom overlays the property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pandemonium as the street is clogged with POLICE VEHICLES MEDIC UNITS. Braddock arrives with Cobb and Marandino. Bud moves alongside a PARAMEDIC wheeling a gurneyed Jesse with a pressure bandage and splint, onto an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Braddock) We run 'em now, Mike. Right fuckin' now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: E/I. LUCIAN'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: A huge BATTERING RAM knocks it right off the hinges. SWAT Bud rush in with rifles... ...Room by room. Everyone clears. The house is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: E/I. STEEL MILL
dialogues.text: SWAT TEAMS have secured the premises. Two HELICOPTERS swe the grounds via SPOTLIGHT. A manhunt for Lucian Adams. INSIDE, Cobb on his radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one here, Bud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud listens on his radios as SWAT OFFICERS file out of th vacant house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio filter) Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud stands there, infuriated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse, unconscious in bed, with IV lines re-infusing plas Bud is with a DOCTOR, who washes his hands in a sink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His bleeding's under control. There's tissue damage. Projectile fragmentation in the right forearm. We have most of it removed. Two fingers are gone. A portion of the palm. There's no chance of reconstruction. (Bud's silence) I'll be monitoring his vitals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor walks away. Bud turns as a NURSE dims the lights a pulls the curtains, obscuring Jesse...

dialogues.speaker: I/E. OUR LADY OF THE LAKE HOSPITAL
dialogues.text: Bud, absorbed, walks past crowded emergency room activity

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Braddock is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares for a moment) You have to let go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in his eyes) The cover's blown. Lucian's gone. There ain't nothin' left on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, hearing it. Feeling every bit of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to a safe-house, Bud.  (hands Bud a set of keys) 'Squad car over there is your's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braddock walks off. Bud watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud drives in dark silence. As the hospital recedes, Bud pulls a flask from his coat, takes a drink...

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: Sunlight rises through a gap in the dark sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEPARD'S FUNERAL. UNIFORMED POLICEMEN saluting as a PRIE gives the eulogy.

dialogues.speaker: BUD
dialogues.text: at the gravesite, with Braddock, Cobb and Marandino. A sa is FIRED with rifles.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Bud stands alone. Dry-eyed, vacant stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashbulbs burst rapid-fire as coroner crews and police secure a crime scene: Richard Morris sits dead at the whe of his car, a plastic bag over his head filled with blood IN THE FOREGROUND, lit by police lights, is Bud and Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...His cranium was smashed with a lead pipe. Then the plastic bag. He choked to death while it filled up with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got I.D.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Name's Richard Morris. He's a top dog lawyer-lobbyist out of Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb proffers Morris' wallet. Bud sifts through cards -- Several businesses, out of state -- Then stops cold at on "Daniel J. Kiersey, Attorney at Law"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put a tap on that line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braddock ain't gonna like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braddock arrives on scene. Disturbed expression:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud. I just got off with Nokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PARTITIONER bandages Jesse's swollen and stitched hand. fingers and thumb remain. There's a KNOCK O.S. Jesse looks up to see Bud enter from the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us a minute, Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Partitioner exits. Jesse, raw nerves raked. Looks to Bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn emerges from the grocery, looking sad and prematurel aged. Her baby in the cart, tucked between bags of food.  FBI #3 (TOM) helps Lynn and the baby into an Unmarked Car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn sits in back with the baby. Tom, at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else while we're out, Mrs. Wheeler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD: FLASHING CONSTRUCTION LIGHTS come into view. A DETOUR. And a team of LABORERS at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a dozen cops comin' in and outta this place. No one's sayin' shit. 'The hell's goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud stares intently, waits for his cue, can't find it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LABORER #1 steps INTO FRAME with a STOP SIGN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaches Tom's window) Wait here a moment, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crane moves past, hoisting steel. Tom IDLES the engine. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gestures) Thanks for waiting. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom drives onward, glancing in the REARVIEW: at Laborer # watching them pull away, receding in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me out of here, Bud. I want to see my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, the pit in his stomach widening, struggles to say:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom - calm and alert - looks to his right - SEES a child' BICYCLE parked on the sidewalk. A BACKPACK affixed to the handlebars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CARGO VAN pulls up and parks. The Labor Team abandons i dumping gloves and outer clothing into plastic bags,

dialogues.speaker: REVEALING
dialogues.text: The bags go in the back of a waiting SUBURBAN. Catfish ta the wheel. The crew climbs in, drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JESSE. Absorbing this. His face begins to tremble. Eye press shut. They fill with moisture as he looks away. HOLD ON BUD. Quiet. Struggling to hide his own emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING WITH BUD, as he heads for the exit. Under harsh fluorescents...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pouring rain. It's a madhouse outside. A crowd is gathered around a pol action in progress. MEDICS are tending to the broken nose a bartender (PETE) in his 30s. METRO COP #1 stands by.  A car pulls up and Cobb gets out with Marandino. They approach the bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Metro #1) He's out of his mind. 'Asked him to slow down; and he punched me in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb and Marandino approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to bartender) Hey, Pete. You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm alright. The bar ain't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Metro #1) We'll smooth it out. Clear the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb and Marandino start toward the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is A MESS. Chairs broken, tables overturned. Mu BLARES on the jukebox. And empty except Bud... three shee to the wind, drunk. Pacing the ruins with his 9MM in hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all fuck with me? Huh? You want to fuck with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb and Marandino peer in the doorway to see Bud, shouti and threatening a vacant chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud flips another table. Continues talking to the chair a someone were in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Look at me when I talk to you. (aims his 9MM) You try and kill me? You like killin' women and kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud holsters his gun and beats the shit out of the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud spins, glass-eyed and red-faced. His wavering vision barely make out Cobb and Marandino approaching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Bud... Easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got you here, Bud... It's just us. Hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud stands his ground, tries to keep his balance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a long moment. Bud stares at his crew, gone. Then he's suddenly overwhelmed with emotion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two FBI AGENTS #4 and #5 walk together down this sterile corridor. They stop outside Jesse's closed door. A unifor POLICE OFFICER is posted there, reading a newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here to escort Mr. Wheeler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up a chart) Sign this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI #4 signs the chart. The two agents enter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's bed is empty. The window open. Curtains billowing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI #5 opens the bathroom door. Empty. Both Agents hurry the window, SEE OUTSIDE: A large TREE six feet out from t ledge and a broken branch at street level. A seemingly impossible escape route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonofabitch. This guy's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A badly hung-over Bud sits with Braddock, Fitch and numer agents around a conference table.

dialogues.speaker: NOKES
dialogues.text: walks the room, says to all:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an atrocity, gentlemen. Incompetence at it's highest level. I gave you my name. My resources. My trust...Carte blanche. And now this handsome face of mine...can't step foot in Washington, for fear of being laughed off the Hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nokes circles behind Bud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I'd love to point to Local on this. But truth is, they've carried their weight. We are federally fucked...  (looks right at Fitch) Because Federal fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitch wipes sweat, swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Best idea wins, gentlemen. Chain of command? Point of procedure? I don't give a fuck. That's out the window, just like our informant...  (beat) I want Jesse Wheeler found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As everyone files out. Braddock says low to Bud:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smell like a fuckin' distillery, Bud. Clean up... 'find your boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BUD. Tired eyes. Everything else, and now this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A metal door rises up. Jesse, in silhouette, steps in. A BARE BULB comes to light. Mottled with fly excrement. Jesse unlocks and opens several SAMSONITE SUITCASES. Stac in grey packing foam are rows and rows of GUNS. Jesse hefts his choices. Checking line and breach: A 12 G Shotgun. A Colt .357 Magnum. A Remington sawed-off with pistol grip. Les Baer Tactical .45. Glock Semi-auto 9MM. Knife. Duct tape. 5-Gallon gas cans. He loads up a gym ba Jesse pulls scissors from a grooming kit and stands befor grimy mirror. He cuts off his hair. Then using clippers, shaves his scalp and mustache.  Jesse yanks a tarp off a '75 beat-up Chrysler. Pops the trunk. Throws in the gym bag. Then drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone, dilapidated HOUSE BOAT sits heavily in the bayou. Lights on inside. Dense FOG overlays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long-Hair on the couch, watching tv, drinking liquor. SPE METAL MUSIC blasts from a stereo somewhere. There's a METALLIC BANG O.S. Long-Hair looks up. The screen door rattles. Long-Hair grabs an aluminum bat, slowly approaching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sudden surprise as the screen SNAPS OFF and a SILHOUETTE breaks the glass, opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long-Hair RUSHES for the door as THE BUTT OF A 12-GAUGE S DOWN LIKE A TOMAHAWK. Long-Hair collapses with a shattered knee and muted screa Jesse steps in, racking the gauge with one hand, takes ai the helpless Long-Hair writhing on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front lights go out. A terrible darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door flies open. Jesse, eyes darting, pushes Long-Hair Bandaged hand clamped to the collar. Shotgun at the neck. They move down a dark hallway. SPEED METAL throbs, growin LOUDER... Long-Hair, gash gushing, leg crunches with each step... They turn another hallway... Light spills from un a door, shadows behind it... Jesse edges Long-Hair forwar reaches the doorway, creeps through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings wide on the room, REVEALING: Buzz, on the bed, furiously fucking a dark-haired HOOKER, over a burea As Long-Hair rounds the corner... Buzz looks up, SEES Jes Dives for a gun. CHROME FLASHES. Everything EXPLODES at o The WALL DETONATES and Buzz goes down. Shocked. Choking. Blood juts from his side. He tries to get up. Can't. The HOOKER SCREAMS and cowers terrified in the corner. Jesse pumps, aims through the haze and fires again. Stere explodes. MUSIC CUTS OUT, plunging us into silence. Jesse tosses clothes to the Hooker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hooker does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two chairs. Buzz and Long-Hair back to back. Hands and fe tied. Blood spigoting. Jesse circles them with the shotgu The boat rocks gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got some shit to discuss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz, to Jesse, unintimidated:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't got nothin' to say to you, Wheeler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (top of his lungs) I need a doctor! I need a fuckin' doctor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one motion, Jesse racks the shotgun, thrusts the barre Long-Hair's chin AND BLOWS HIS HEAD OFF. Buzz screams, REARS UP, chair collapses beneath him, DRAG a dead Long-Hair along the floor, still tied together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FUCK! FUCK! OH, FUCK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: House call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse YANKS Buzz up. His chair rocks upright, into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Lucian?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse punctuates, shotgun butt against Buzz's head. Neck snaps. Teeth rattle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO ONE KNOWS WHERE LUCIAN IS! NO ONE KNOWS-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse strikes again, connects. Buzz goes down in a heap, swollen purple slits. His skull gushing red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse steps over Buzz, pins the shotgun to his jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who killed my family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah shit, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse shifts his aim an inch, pulls the trigger. SHOT REV HARD. Buzz SCREAMS, hysteria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (racks another shell) WHO KILLED 'EM?! CATFISH?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATFISH, YES, YEAH! FUCKIN' CATFISH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse puts down the shotgun. Pulls from his gym bag, two OF GASOLINE, one of which, he splashes over Buzz's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flinches) The fuck is that? (sniffs, realizes) WAIT, WAIT! WHAT ARE YOU DOIN'?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse pours the rest over Buzz and the lifeless Long-Hair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrashing) NO! NO, NO, NO, DON'T!! DON'T!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Buzz pleads for his life, Jesse unloads the shotgun, d aim...FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: THE MUZZLE FLASH. GASOLINE IGNITES. BUZZ GOES UP IN FLAME
dialogues.text: Instantly, a FIRE ERUPTS. Buzz and Long-Hair's corpses BU Jesse empties the other can of gas, FEEDING THE FLAMES. T FIRE SPREADS. BURNING THE WALLS. THE FLOOR AND CEILING. Jesse stands there, the heat reflects the intensity in hi face. For a moment, it's a vision in hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engulfed in flames. SIRENS and LIGHTS as FIRE TRUCKS and BOATS douse the burning boat with hard water. Among a crowd of SPECTATORS, the shaken Hooker is being questioned by Marandino. Bud and Cobb stand apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had a tap on Kiersey's line forty eight hours now. It's clean. Whatever's he's up to, Bud, it ain't comin' through the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud starts leaving the scene. Suddenly FITCH and two AGEN barge forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter! We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my way, Fitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (following Bud) This is my investigation. Jesse's cowboy bullshit is not how it's done!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While your agents build their cases and set for court, he'll erase the debt owed to all of you. Overnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're implying I should thank him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud shakes his head in disgust, keeps walking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Carter, whether we like it or not, you and I have to work together on this. We entice Jesse back. I'll get him full protection, if he agrees to testify.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll never happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hell not?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns) 'Cause it's over, Fitch. It's done. He has nothing. Why do you think he lit that fire? To plant a flag. To let us know he doesn't need our protection. Doesn't want it. He would've just left 'em for dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God sakes, listen to me! I'm not taking the fall for this! The plan is--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the truth is, Fitch, you ain't got balls big enough to relate to this guy. If you had listened to me, we wouldn't be in this situation. Jesse wouldn't be in this situation. And you wouldn't be askin' stupid fuckin' questions! (walking away) I'll bring him in myself. Just keep your agents off my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn stumbles through the woods, holding her baby. Scared Lost. Their skin bleached-out. Eyes hollow. Like appariti We're in a dream. A sadistic enhancement.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE'S EYES
dialogues.text: His family's image dissolves inside them. WIDEN to reveal Jesse before a cracked mirror in a SERVIC STATION BATHROOM. Perspiring, he re-bandages his hand as blood swirls down the drain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An expensively dressed Kiersey emerges from a courtroom, flanked by a pair of well dressed AIDES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back to the office. Follow up on the Arthur Bierce case. I need names and numbers on my desk by three pm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Aides scurry down another corridor, as Kiersey exits building through the glass front doors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiersey moves to a parked Cadillac pops the trunk and set his briefcase inside, when... A RUSHING POV FROM BEHIND: Slams the trunk on Kiersey's h Kiersey SCREAMS, drops to his knees. His wrists wedged in trunk. And standing over him...is Bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OH, CHRIST! JESUS CHRIST! MY HANDS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN THE TRUNK! PLEASE! OPEN THE TRUNK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud kicks him in the stomach, doubles him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who the fuck I am?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Richard Morris?! Why was he killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. Bud pounds on the trunk. Kiersey CRIES OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll break every fuckin' bone you got. Start talkin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hyperventilating) I can't-- I can't--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud slams both fists on the trunk. All his weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Kiersey's SCREAM) Can't what?! What can't you do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, enraged, kicks Kiersey's ribs in. Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You piece of shit, talk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hysterical) He made Jesse...The investigation... Everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything! After that, he was just a loose end!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud opens the trunk. Kiersey crumbles to the ground, shak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Lucian Adams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud jams a foot in Kiersey's neck. Grabs his hands and be We HEAR bones snap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucian's goin' down. You either go down together, or you give him to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a mile a minute) I never talk to him directly! I swear, they page me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud roughly searches Kiersey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Every night at five, for a six o'clock call! They page from different numbers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud finds a PAGER on Kiersey's slacks, yanks it off. Then leans down with a smile, venomous:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a dead man, Kiersey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud storms off. Kiersey on the ground, a trembling mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish does a rail of meth off the counter. He lights a cigarette and sits down in a re-upholstered l boy where a TATTOO ARTIST is setting up...  Catfish proffers his forearm, displaying a row of notches (kills). And Tattoo Artist begins to outline two more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bout out of room, Catfish. You best start collectin' scalps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish smugs. Drags on his cigarette... WHEN A SUDDEN GUNSHOT SPRAYS CATFISH WITH BLOOD. Tattoo Artist drops dead on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up) What the fuck?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse, standing over Catfish. A .45 comes down twice fast with a CRACK! Catfish is knocked cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, on police radio, driving high-speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud's VOICE over speaker phone. Marandino on the line wit sheaf of paperwork. Cobb enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in the French Quarter. All numbers paging Kiersey between five and six p.m., the last seventy-two hours, are pay phones within a three mile radius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, you gotta talk to Braddock. He's lookin' for you, he's fuckin' pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold him off. I'll square it with him when I get to the Quarter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud punches the gas, traveling 90 mph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATFISH'S EYES blink awake - pinpoint dilated. WIDEN TO REVEAL he's stripped to his boxers, tied to the lazy-boy. And Jesse is seated beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna ask questions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse rolls a tattoo tray of various HARDWARE towards him Needles. Rusted pliers. An electric tattoo drill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I'm satisfied with your answers, I'm gonna kill you. How long it takes and how much blood you want to spill...that's up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish grins. A wide, Amphetamine smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to know? Want to hear about your brother? How we had him shot up with strychnine? How he died slow death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without warning, Jesse grabs the PLIERS. A flash of movem and there's a TERRIBLE SCREAM AS CATFISH'S FRONT TOOTH IS RIPPED OUT. He bucks violently in his chair. Jesse jams the DRILL into Catfish's gums, high speed. BLO SPRAYS. Loud, electric pain and Catfish CRIES OUT IN TERR Jesse sets down the drill, deadpan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OH, YOU SONOFABITCH!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four days ago, my wife and son were killed. (pause) I hear you took the contract?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish smiles. Lips quivering with hate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-four pounds, Miznay-Schardin. Like you taught me. Fuck yeah, I took it. Blew your bitch and kid sky high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse grabs the pliers, YANKS another tooth. Catfish HOWL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOTHERFUCKER!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLOOD SPEWS as the drill digs in. Catfish SCREAMS. Jesse tosses teeth on the tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrashing wildly) OH, YOU'RE GONNA DIE! YOU'RE GONNA FUCKIN' DIE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse grabs Catfish's rapidly swelling jaw and yanks hard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Lucian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse TIGHTENS his grip. Vice-like. Blood fills Catfish's mouth. He gurgles, then SPITS in Jesse's face...  ...FLASHES OF STEEL and two more teeth rip out at the roo Catfish SCREAMS then passes out. Jesse slaps him awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he hidin' out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish, last ounce of spite, cracks a blackened grin:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DRILL STRIKES. Bone deep. Gum line splays open. Teeth crack and split. Catfish SCREAMS UNCONTROLLABLY. Blacks o Jesse stops. A brief reprieve. He gets up and looks aroun the apartment. SEES: Magazines. A few revolvers. Empty li bottles. Meth on the counter. And on the stove:   A HYPODERMIC NEEDLE. Beside a pie tin, speed base boiling Jesse stares. He lowers the syringe into the tin, plunger drawing fluid... ...then very deliberately sticks Catfish's arm with the t of the needle, pops a cc.   Catfish bolts awake, EYES WIDE. A long, wet WHEEZE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Lucian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish's head lulls. Jesse grabs him by the hair. Leans

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Lucian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible) New Orleans...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New Orleans. Where in New Orleans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New Orleans...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse looks Catfish dead in the eyes. And death is there. Begging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Jesse pushes the plunger down...ever...so...sl Blood burps and bubbles from Catfish's throat. Lungs conv and spasm. Eye go wide then roll back. A suicide dose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSE'S CAR racing up I-10, along the roaring Mississippi toward a blood red horizon of a Louisiana sundown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars line crowded streets in the heart of New Orleans.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BUD'S CAR
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON A DASHBOARD CLOCK: 5:04 p.m. Bud, waiting, parked outside a POLICE PRECINCT in the Low French Quarter. Kiersey's pager on the dash. Waiting. The THE PAGER BUZZES. Bud grabs it, hurries out to a nearby pay-phone. Dials...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) It's Bud. I got a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb on a database, phone cradled...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (types, searches) Governor Nicholls Wharf. Between St. Ann and Toulouse. You're a half mile south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your ass down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud slams down the phone. Jumps in his car. Hits the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A busy promenade near the down river end of the Mississip Bud waits low in his car, parked in a distant lot. Throug the windshield, WE SEE the subject of his surveillance...

dialogues.speaker: A PAY-PHONE
dialogues.text: on a crowded sidewalk. Faces pass. A Man in a JACKET arri at the phone. He waits. Checks his watch... ...Bud checks his clock: 6:10 The "Jacket" picks up the phone and dials...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacket waits. No call. Walks away. Bud FOLLOWS on foot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sprawling swirl of humanity, live jazz and bars. The Ja passes through. Twenty feet back, Bud keeps pace...

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PHONE BOOTH
dialogues.text: Jacket enters. Pumps coins into the PAY-PHONE. Dials...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recording) You've reached the law offices of Daniel J. Kiersey--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacket hangs up. More coins. Another number...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recording) Hello, you've reached the Kiersey residence. No one's home right now--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacket hangs up. Exits east onto BARRACKS STREET. Glances over his shoulder, then ahead, as Bud rounds the corner..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacket crosses into a LIQUOR STORE.  Bud stalls at the corner, casing the street. Takes everyt in. He reaches for his cigarettes, finds a crumpled back. Then crosses the street to...

dialogues.speaker: A NEWSSTAND
dialogues.text: outside the liquor store. Bud buys cigarettes and a newsp He opens the paper, glances at the headlines. At the same time, peers into the LIQUOR STORE WINDOW...  ...The Jacket walks toward the back of the store and out door to an ALLEY. Bud heads south on Decatur. Lights a cigarette, as he pas various stores on the block. A private two-story building with blacked out windows at the far end: "TIBEDAUX'S TAVE Bud turns into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lined with boutiques on one side. Back of Tibedaux's on t other. A cargo gate is up and MEN are hoisting crates int truck...   The Jacket is there, talking to them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should've been on the road twenty minutes ago. Hurry it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud pauses at a DRESS SHOP. Stares into the storefront gl reflecting the Jacket and Men...    Jacket walks off. Bud flicks his cigarette, enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and peers out the window, watching the Jacket leave th alley and enter a FRENCH COLONIAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECURITY GUARD behind a desk. As Jacket walks in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacket moves through a warren of CORRIDORS. Hardened MEN shuttle in and out of private offices. Plates on the door "Material Management." "Plating & Metal". "Demolition Jacket knocks on a door. Opens it to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bulked-out man at his desk... MILLS. Looks up as Jacket enters:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got nothin' to tell. Kiersey didn't call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try his office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Ain't there. His home neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mills picks up the desk-phone. Dials...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) It's Mills. I need sweepers through Baton Rouge. Find Daniel Kiersey. (then to Jacket) Keep pagin' him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacket exits the Colonial and enters a corner CAFE. INSID WE SEE Jacket move to a pay-phone and dial...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON KIERSEY'S PAGER, as it BUZZES again.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: now seated at the window of this second-story room, using BINOCULARS to case the surrounding perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. Show me somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV THROUGH BINOCULARS: as the night comes alive. Trucks to and from the alley. Patrons valet and enter Tibedaux's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braddock, walking down the hall with two POLICEMEN, unloc heavy door and enters...

dialogues.speaker: A HOLDING ROOM
dialogues.text: ...where Kiersey waits. Pale skin, beaded in sweat. Both hands in casts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Kiersey. I'm Captain Mike Braddock. How can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Bud Carter is out of control!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (corrects him) Detective "Lieutenant." Now how can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiersey, a shaky breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long till you make an arrest in your investigation of Lucian Adams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braddock, just stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm willing to provide you with documents and information to secure his conviction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think? I'm afraid for my life. (and the hammer) I'll confirm whatever Jesse Wheeler's given you.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FRENCH QUARTER
dialogues.text: AERIAL SHOT: LOOKING DOWN as a TOWN CAR circles the block

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio filter) Got a possible here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TOWN CAR passes slow... REVEAL NOW: MARANDINO, staked having dinner outside the cafe. Crowded tables around him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio filter) Town Car. Black. Second time around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING WITH THE TOWN CAR, as it turns onto ESPLANADE AVEN and parks before the Colonial. REVEAL NOW: COBB, in a nondescript VAN. Parked a quarter block off Esplanade. He triggers photos through tinted gl STILL PHOTOS CLICK -- the Town Car doors open. Two AB SOLDIERS step out. Bulges where their holsters are. Then third man from in back: A boss, HAROLD KAY, 50s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Bud, you see this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUD'S POV THROUGH BINOCULARS: Kay escorted into the Colon

dialogues.speaker: I/E. COBB'S VAN
dialogues.text: Parked on Chartres Avenue. Covering the alley. With binoculars, he can SEE the high point of the Colonial.  And we see now, Bud has this place surrounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as a light goes on, into radio) They're on the second floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud grabs the phone. Dials...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braddock on the line:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone) It's Bud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better have something fuckin' good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the French Quarter. Sittin' on AB activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know yet. I got Harold Kay so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braddock looks to the AB ORGANIZATIONAL CHART on the wall MUG SHOT of HAROLD KAY atop one branch of AB SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like they own the God damn block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I got Kiersey just walked in. Two fractured wrists and scared as all hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can explain--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to make a deal, Bud. I can keep Nokes in the dark twenty-four hours, but that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb's VOICE comes over the radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio filter) Bud, we got movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hold on, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud cradles the phone, picks up the radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Go ahead...

dialogues.speaker: I/E. COBB'S VAN
dialogues.text: OUT THE BACK WINDSHIELD: A LINCOLN arrives at the cafe. C doors open... COBB CLICKS PHOTOS -- another boss emerges, EDGAR BINGHAM flanked by two more AB SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUD'S POV THROUGH BINOCULARS: Kay and Mills exit the Colonial. Bingham and Kay shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio filter) It's cookin', Bud. It's cookin' fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Mike, I've got Edgar Bingham now. Just showed with two of his crew, for a sit down with Kay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he scans the AB CHART again. MUG SHOT of HAROLD BINGHAM a another branch of AB SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingham, Kay, Mills and two Soldiers start toward the CAF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio filter) Marandino, they comin' your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marandino looks up from his table, to find this crew of m walking right for him. Marandino stares. A frozen moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud throws down his binoculars and takes up a .50 CALIBER BURROWS RIFLE, lays an eye on the SCOPE. BUD'S POV THROUGH THE SCOPE (MAGNIFIED): the cross-hairs Kay and Bingham moving toward Marandino...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Got 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew of men getting closer now, a few yards away... Marandino - heart racing - slides his Browning 9MM out an slips it onto the table, below his napkin, aims... ...When the crew abruptly turns and enters the cafe. Marandino exhales relief...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio filter) They're inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud sits back. Then:  KIERSEY'S PAGER BUZZES AGAIN. (The cafe number)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs phone, to Braddock) Mike, I need Kiersey to place a call. Five minutes, or this opportunity's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Give me the number...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingham, Kay and Mills at a booth, sipping coffee. Two Soldiers guard the front and back doors.  Mills looks at Jacket, who waits by the pay-phone. Both noticeably on edge. Finally -- The PAY-PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kay + Bingham) Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up, walks toward the phone. When Jacket answers, Mills takes the receiver from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nervous Kiersey on the line. Braddock, Policemen nearby

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone) We've been pagin' you over two hours. Where the fuck you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologize. I've been tooth and nail with the D.A., in court, all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's fine. Just lay low. Regular time tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mills hangs up. Kiersey turns. Pale. To Braddock:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now get me protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mills returns to the booth. Kay and Bingham look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All good. Let's eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marandino watches as Bingham, Kay and Mills pull their co on and exit the cafe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into transmitter) Call went down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUD'S POV THROUGH THE SCOPE: watching as Bingham, Kay and Mills enter Tibedaux's Tavern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filter) Entering Tibedaux's Tavern...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A busy nightclub crowded wall-to-wall with PATRONS. FOLLOW Kay, Bingham and Mills, passing tables, greeting "connected" types... and through a far door into a back r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW Marandino as he walks down the street, knocks on t back of the Van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb, now dressed in evening attire, throws open the door Marandino climbs in. They exchange transmitter for headse and Cobb leaves the van for the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb approaches the front door, where a pair of large DOO stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just lookin' for a drink and a bite to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you'll find what you're lookin' for across the street.   (gestures) Try the cafe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb stares at both Doormen #1 and #2, immovable forces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUD'S POV THROUGH BINOCULARS: Cobb leaves Tibedaux's and positions himself at an outdoor table in the cafe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio filter) Negative at Tibedaux's. Can't walk in. What's our move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) We wait.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTS OF COBB AND MARANDINO
dialogues.text: waiting. Patrons empty out. Cars drive away.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTS OF BUD
dialogues.text: He waits. And waits. And nothing happens. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio filter) I've got movement. Back alley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD: Back of Tibedaux's. A BALCONY GUARD emerges with a rifle, posts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio filter) Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) I've got a man on the south balcony. Armed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door below opens and a second GUARD steps out, posts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Second man at the door now. Street level. Possibly armed.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY HEADLIGHTS FLOOD MARANDINO'S REAR WINDSHIELD.
dialogues.text: Marandino ducks, a reflex action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights from a CADILLAC and a GRAND MARQUIS appear and com down the street - past Cobb - SLOWLY. Blacked out windows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV THROUGH WINDSHIELD: as the cars turn into the alley..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) A Cadillac and a Grand Marquis, just pulled in the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and stop behind Tibedaux's.  Passenger doors of both cars open, two AB SOLDIERS emerge They open the rear door of the Cadillac and shadow the ma they're escorting: LUCIAN. Balcony Guard looks on as Door Guard allows Lucian and hi Soldiers to enter the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
